title: How to write a letter to a girlfriend - Quora

response.answer_text: A2A You don't think or ask how to write a letter to the person you love. It happens when your feelings are overwhelming you and that person is not around.When I was in love, there was a time I missed him terribly. I took a paper and scribbled whatever that came to my mind about how innocent his eyes looked when he sees puppies, how his eyelashes are the most perfect curls, how the way he gives me a wink makes my heart stop a beat, what he means to me and how I miss him when he is not around. A letter is a reflection of your heart and feelings.The moment You feel like telling your love something just start writing. Let the words flow with the fluidity of your emotions.Tell her things that she thinks you miss, but you take note of. Tell her something about her that you noticed and she doesn't have an idea about. The moment you start writing, it should not focus on words, language or grammar. It is just the heart telling another heart how its beats are synchronized.

Sometimes it happens that we are very much in know of our feelings,but we are not sure how to express it.Moreover,when this feeling is none other than love ,then our mind and heart get so dazzled by this beautiful feeling that we are almost lost.So, to write letter to your girlfriend,first of all make yourself free and sit in a peaceful environment.Then start writing-Pen down everything that you feel about her,irrespective of how silly it's.Sometimes,it's good to be silly.Write how much you cherish the moments spend with her,how your heart escapes from the thought of being without her,how your life becomes so lively when she's with you .How beautifully she has not only touched your heart but your soul too.How important she's for you and how her existence in your life has made you so positive.How your sleep is preoccupied with her dreams painting her every time you sleep.How deep you have fallen for her.These are a few points that popped in my mind.Start writing.You might end up writing a book instead of letter.
